Title: Great place for hard workers!
Pro: You work for human beings that you actually see and talk to. The partners are experts in their fields that genuinely care about their clients and their employees.

Title: Summer Assitant
Pro:
Colleagues are very willing to help you with any difficulties
Team bonding activities are very common within the organisation, enabled me to easily make friends and bond with my teammates
Con:
Quite local culture, I feel like international people would find it hard to adapt to the culture. 
Overtime hours is common, and everyone does it without complaining, so just do it.

Title: Credit Analyst

Con: work without many challenges or changes, not many interactions among divisions, probably could involve more advanced analytical tools

- There is not a lot of warning before you get a big project

Title: Work

Title: Forward Thinking
Pro: Initiatives from governments are always backed up HR. End of the day, reward and recognition is really down to your personal contribution and how your boss perceives it. Of course everyone would have a contribution, but how your boss perceives the value is really up to them. Hence it is not just about doing work. It is the way we present the work that we do that is important
Con: HR structure within the organization holds too much power The different structures within the organization doesn't allow for easy collaboration

Title: A company where I can Be the Best, Be the Change and Be the Difference
Pro: Family like culture where collaboration and discussions are part & parcel of the daily work Strong internal mobility culture Good channel communication between management team (thru townhalls) and feedback system from the ground (thru 'Tell Piyush' platform)
Con: Speedier decision making process All staff to take better ownership of their role and job

Title: The pros
Pro: They have great employee benefit policies and also competitive compensation. It is a culturally great organization to work for.
Con: If your boss isn't great you might struggle.

Title: Great place to get a lot experience as a banker

Title: Love working here

Title: hello

Title: Lots of opportunities to grow
Pro: In last 4-5 years, there has been a lot of push on experimenting and openness to adopt new technologies. It has become easier to expand roles and find career growth internally if you dare and challenge yourself. Other big organisations and even tech companies have happily taken folks from dbs now, even within my own group due to this experience and have done well.
Con: Couple of tech towers are still very dominated at top so be careful which one you join.

Pro: pay good for starting job
Con: keeping up with sales koi

Title: Best benefits
Pro: Staff benefits outweigh any other perks of the job. 24 AL, 6 day family care leave for parents, insurance coverage for spouse and child, SUPERB HOME LOAN interest rates (staff rates) etc etc
Con: Mincromangement, contradictory management policies, people who manage the organisation at the top level hardly had done the ground work up (very powerfully connected circles of people) , ZERO work life balance, sales driven (zero empathy for customers), fictions portrayal of “Live More Bank Less”

Title: Best local bank in Sg
Pro: Best CEO and Country CEOs
Con: Internal systems and process needs re imagination

Title: Don't Join If you want Process, Horizontal /Team Culture
Pro: Good Salary, Leaves. Good benefits You can take risk for money but don't expect process and culture at least at ITT department
Con: Worked with ITT, Forget Analysis there wont be proper Requirement Gathering . Things keep on changing and brings lot of uncertainty. Poor quality code and practices is very prevalent. One side communication from Singapore, no feedback or suggestions considered from INDIA, Hyderabad. They expect only Yes and Understand words Toxic Culture ( Some of the guys who are with DBS for sometime are behaving the same as Singapore Folks) - very insecure to share knowledge and responsibilities . They create a unnecessary hierarchy with in teams My Voice Survey which impacts Manager hike is a sham Totally rigged and you will be called out if your feedback is not in favour of them . BTW it should be Anonymous They compare on par to Google, Amazon etc but not even close to most of the service based Final word : Join this if you are ok to face politics and toxic culture If you had a good experience with US, UK the big MNC culture then SG culture is a big NO

Title: Best Local Bank in Singapore
Pro: The bank has evolved tremendously over the years, staffs are given more empowerment compared to previous years.
Con: Legacy processes in placed that needs to be reviewed, improve and change.

Title: Great Company

Title: Best Bank In The World

Title: Company is better amongst other banks in Singapore

Con: No body understands technology and everyone especially seniors wants to call themselves technologist. Selection criteria is absolutely week. VP and onwards are not at all hands-on. Problem is senior management don't have any clue. Diversity is no more there.

Title: Good Company for bonus

Title: Work Life Balance in one Department

Title: A great employer

Title: Good Work. Active and Energetic Environment
Pro: peers are competitive. you will be motivated to learn more
Con: hectic work. Work pressure a bit more

Title: Good organisation with leading edge management practices
Pro: DBS is always pushing to implement good organisational practices, such as seeking and FOLLOWING UP on employee feedback, pushing the envelope in adopting technological practices such as common data resources and fostering better culture.
Con: Employees may be pushed too hard with very high expectations. Expect to work long stressful hours to perform well and not lag behind.

Title: Do NOT apply for the CSO position
Pro: Decent pay (at the start before you're before shoved full of responsibilities after going through "AcCeLeRaTeD aNd CoMpReSsEd" training, which is their pr term for overloading you with the supposed "knowledge" you need because so many new hirees are leaving day by day and they need the current staff to pick up their slack due to their failure to retain any of their current staff
Con:
- ZERO worklife balance

- Constantly having to deal with expectations of KPIs to meet, being given ONLY 15 MINUTES a day of personal time to go to the toilet aside from 15 minutes paid break, rest of the time you are expected to take no less than 5 minutes to deal with each call from start till finish including After Call Work

- Constantly being pressured to "pitch in" (OT) as people are leaving by the masses and calls volume is increasing massively day by day. By the way, they dont reward you OT with more money btw. They give you some bs "coins" you use to redeem vouchers from online stores. I would like to be compensated FAIRLY for my time instead of with these coins that they use to dodge having to pay more CPF if they paid in cash instead.

Title: Good company to work
Pro: Dbs provides Very good salary
Con: Work life balance will be hard to manage

Title: Toxic company - Stay away at all costs
Pro:
1. Benifits like leaves, cab facility.
2. Support during COVID like extra leaves for the employees.
Con:
1. Very Toxic work culture. This is the SIngapore working style. If you have never worked with Singapore companies before and always worked for US/Europe companies in your past, avoid DBS at all costs. You can't fit in well and will start looking outside within 4 months.
2. Pushing the employees to come back to office at any costs.
3. No proper Software Development life cycle. You as a developer is responsible for architecture, design, code, test and deploy. If you are hard worker, the entire work will be on you.
4. Business don't understand the technicals and they don't care about the time it takes to complete the tasks. They simply demand the developers to complete in fixed time and we are bound to complete without any other option.
5. Culture is broken. Most of us won't fit in.
6. People are leaving like crazy because of all these issues. Think thrice before joining.

Title: Good culture with HR driving work life balance but manager is toxic
Pro: CEO and top management do a lot to work with HR to drive work life balance and give competitive salary and other benefits. Honestly it’s a good place to work for with union backing as well.
Con: Toxic old timers with unreasonable ask and worse of all is nothing is done even after complaining. Job is good but manager and environment is toxic.

Title: Culture very dependent on department
Pro:
Follow the right boss and you’ll be rewarded. Which may be actually be a con.
Overall very friendly environment and easy to get along, so long as you are not in a hurry to get things done
Con:
Every department has their own quirks. Mine happens to be a retirement ground hence everyone is laid back and any sorts of advancement is always hampered by the people on the ground despite how hard the management pushes. Everyone simply waiting for their time there. High turnover for the younger staff below 30s due to 2 factors
1. OT and 2. Lack of transparency for promotion criteria. Other departments have people promoted in consecutive years. However, this department will insist no one is worthy, and wouldn’t explicitly show why or how

Title: Decent place to work
Pro:
Good teammates

Management encourage team player by having team activities. But really depends on the team and managers.
Con: Sometimes you can see the older people who have been working in this company still having the hierarchical mindset. But can see that they are trying to adopt flat team management.

Title: Enter At you r own risk(If you dept. starts with I*GT)
Pro: Best Looking Office, Second to none. Their talent upgrade infrastructure is also standard
Con:
The work culture is exactly the one you see in YouTube channels and get scared to death. What I am mentioning below is not just a personal experience. I was the last person to exit from my team who had all faced similar situatons.

CoVid: To start off, these guys were the last to shut down offices when covid started! Despite the complaints and agitations. As a result, a heavy percentage of young workforce got trapped in PGs for a really long time. Their infrastructure was not prepared for WFH and productivity took a hit. And instead of relaxing the timelines, they made it worse! 9 hr. day turned to 15 hr. soon and then the immediate managers started showing their colors. I was literally asked to have paracetamol and work when I had covid.

Usual scene: There is insane amount of favourism and mafia type situation, starting from junior management itself. Talent is worshiped here too! But don't expect accelerated growth just because of that. You will just be a very talented mule. Don't expect good ratings and increments just because you did good job. One of my colleagues got bad rating just because she complaint about here manager. He was rude because she could not deliver as she was stuck in a PG without proper internet, food and water!!!

Technical Infrastructure : There is none! you'll get new or changed requirements 2 hrs. before the production deployment. There are no good software development practices followed.

Con: Everyone is just busy with their own thing. Need to figure your own way out

Title: Zero work life balance
Pro: high salary but salary is not everything
Con:
1) While I am joining I was surprised about Salary which they are paying, after joining I felt so bad for why I haven't asked more
2) Manages Feel like they hired us for 12 hrs. of working hours, so please don't ask me about Work life balance
3) They don't give any accesses for UAT or QA and in DEV you wont get data to test your code but task should be completed it in 1 or 2 days max, asking stable environment is a big crime
4) Managers will not discuss about your future aspirations and asked my manager about my interested working area, he told why should I care about emerging technologies out side DBS, if you want you can try outside and free to leave the company. I am so happy for his concern because it triggers me to searching outside job and got my aspirated role
5) Can some one suggest me that how we can improve spark app performance, with out seeing spark application URL and logs, but here it happens
6) They work for Stand up meeting status, not for application completeness
7) Don't ask about business logic to Singapore BA's, they will escalate you on this because Developer should tell the business logic to BA and Business people
8) I had many bad experiences please pardon me for not posting

Title: Not a good place to work
Pro: Though there are some good teams still there in DBS, my team was the worst. However, for a tech enthu, if you got the opportunity, you would probably explore many new technologies.
Con:
In many places, it is due to the management, people leave. Same goes here. 
1. Singapore contractors drive most of the projects. No control from India.
2. Even if team delivers some of the big projects, Singapore leads and manager, would never leave an appreciation mail.
3. No project grooming for the developers on the new projects, but will just send the BRD documents. And you have to chase the BA on what you have to do. Why dont they think that it helps to have all the developers on the grooming sessions, so they dont have conduct separate such sessions.
4. Project deliveries are always in rush.

Con: Long working hours especially in IBD

Title: Work Hard - Dont work Smart
Pro:
- Get to meet some really great people and make friends for life
- Get to work on a product that you use
Con:
- You're judged based on how late you work. Efficiency does not matter.
- Sending emails is more important in career growth than doing the actual work. 
- Claims as "Tech" company and "Startup", but in reality, it's far from that. None of the senior management has ever worked in a tech company or a startup so the culture and mindset are still 5 to 10 years behind any tech company.
- Way too many people than needed.

I was deployed in Hyderabad based DBS (DAH2) as SM/Project Manager frim HCL. My observations are in below-

- Good office infrastructure too.
- Sr management is accesible and open to accept suggestions and feedback.
- Rewards and recognitions also awarded to vendor resourced.

- Agile based Org.

I have seen all good and a nice organization to hang for long term.
Con: No cons I have seen so-far.

Title: "Live less, Bank More" is "FAKE"
Pro:
1. People are very friendly and willing to talk, good culture
2. Salary is satisfactory and have promotion path
3. Compensation package and benefits are fine and well-preparedly structured 
4. Live more, Bank Less is the attractively fake things.
5. Have many leaves other than AL.
6. Willing to listen.
Con:
1. Live less, Bank MORE is the cruel fact with no doubt.
2. They focus on the work life balance, but no work life balance. 
3.  uneven job allocation, i.e. unlimited workload vs limited resource 
4. Smooth less, struggle MORE.
5. You have many leaves but you don't have time to leave.
6. Willing to listen, but fairly failed to implement.
